Violation_Type: Failure to meet refugee criteria under the 1951 Refugee Convention
Legal_Issue: Whether the applicants qualify as Convention refugees based on a well-founded fear of persecution due to political opinion or family membership
Application_Facts: The male applicant was detained for political activities but later returned to Sudan voluntarily; worked illegally in the U.S.; did not claim asylum there; inconsistencies in testimony
Decision_Outcome: Applicants do not qualify as Convention refugees
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the decision by the Convention Refugee Determination Division
Claimant_Status: Applicants seeking refugee status in Canada
Defendant_Behavior: Voluntary return to Sudan, illegal work in the U.S., failure to seek asylum in the U.S.
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under the 1951 Refugee Convention
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, re-entry into country of origin, delay in claiming refugee status, prior opportunity for protection
Procedural_Issue: Delay in claiming refugee status, credibility assessment during judicial review
Credibility_Assessment: Found not credible due to voluntary return to Sudan and inconsistent testimony
Evidence_Used: Testimony of applicants, history of detention, travel and immigration records
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to political opinion and family membership
Evidence_Assessed: Inconsistencies in testimony, actions after leaving Sudan
Relief_Sought: Recognition as Convention refugees, successful judicial review
Governing_Rule: A refugee must have a well-founded fear of persecution for reasons of race, religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of credible evidence supporting continued fear of persecution
Outcome: Application for refugee status denied; judicial review dismissed
Harm_Assessment: No established risk of persecution upon return to Sudan
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee status in Canada after being denied by the Convention Refugee Determination Division
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility based on conduct and testimony
Evidence_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of corroborating evidence
Residency_Compliance: Illegal residence and work in the U.S. without seeking protection
Misrepresentation_Element: Potential misrepresentation due to inconsistent statements
Jurisdictional_Issue: Applicants bypassed potential protection in the U.S.
Evidence_Assessment: Negative credibility finding based on post-flight conduct and testimony
Decision_Rationale: Fear of persecution not well-founded due to voluntary return and lack of credible evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of documentation
